intro: Epicharis brachypoda, commonly known as the short-stemmed epicharis, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that collect water, creating a small pool that supports various microorganisms. The plant produces striking inflorescences with brightly colored flowers, typically in shades of red, orange, or yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing on rocky outcrops or in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike.
